svcsubsecinfo.para: The following disassembly procedure applies to the two piston caliper assembly. The same procedure will apply to the single piston caliper except where noted.
The following procedure is for one wheel/ brake assembly only. Repeat same procedure for each wheel/brake assembly.

step1.para: Position vehicle on floor stands. Remove tire and wheel assembly at axle end to be serviced.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para:
Inspect master cylinder fluid level and remove fluid if necessary. Refer to step 2 SERVICE PRECAUTIONS
.

Insert a screwdriver through the opening in the center of the caliper and in one of the rotor cooling fin slots. Be sure caliper will move on V-way surface before prying. Pry the caliper outboard forcing the caliper piston(s) into the cylinder bore(s). This will allow removal of the caliper assembly ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Forcing Piston Into Cylinder Bore

step1.para: Remove support key retaining bolt. Using a blunt nose drift punch, lightly tap support key and spring out of caliper assembly ( Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Removing Caliper Support Key and Spring

step1.para: If the caliper has to be removed, disconnect the hydraulic hose and plug off hose/line from leaking fluid.
Remove the caliper from the anchor plate and support caliper. Do not let the caliper hang by the caliper flex hose or possible damage may occur to the flex hose.
Remove inboard pad from the anchor plate and the outboard pad from the caliper housing.

Place a suitable metal plate over caliper piston(s). If a metal plate is not available, use the inboard caliper pad metal side against piston face. Using a "C" clamp as shown ( Figure 16), tighten "C" clamp and press caliper pistons into caliper bores. This action will allow clearance for new pads to clear the rotor on installation. If other calipers have been removed from rotor assembly, place a suitable block between the piston(s) and the caliper housing to keep the caliper piston from being pushed outward when the caliper piston being serviced is compressed.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Forcing Pistons into Caliper Using Metal Plate
